title: BA - Mumbai
description:
Group Company: Physics Wallah

Designation: Associate

Office Location: Branch Office - Mumbai - MH Mumbai (Branch Office - HO - Noida and Pegasus)

Job Summary

The Business Analyst will act as a bridge between business stakeholders and technical teams to understand business needs, analyze processes, and provide data-driven solutions. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, excellent communication abilities, and experience in gathering and translating requirements into actionable deliverables.

Key Responsibilities


Requirements Gathering and Analysis:
Collaborate with stakeholders to elicit, document, and prioritize business and functional requirements.
Analyze current processes and workflows to identify areas of improvement.
Process Improvement:
Evaluate existing systems and recommend optimized solutions to enhance business efficiency.
Design and document new workflows, processes, and system enhancements.
Stakeholder Management:
Act as a liaison between business stakeholders, technical teams, and vendors.
Facilitate workshops, meetings, and presentations to align objectives.
Data Analysis and Reporting:
Analyze data to identify trends, insights, and potential risks.
Develop reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate findings.
Project Support:
Support project management efforts, including timelines, milestones, and resource allocation.
Ensure deliverables meet business requirements and quality standards.
Documentation:
Prepare detailed documentation, including business requirements documents (BRDs), functional specifications, and user stories.
Maintain up-to-date documentation throughout the project lifecycle.

Qualifications

Education:


Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, or a related field.


Experience:


2–5 years of experience as a Business Analyst or in a similar role.
Proven experience in requirements gathering, process improvement, and stakeholder management.


Skills:


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent verbal and written communication abilities.
Proficiency in tools such as Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Jira, or other project management and data visualization tools.
Familiarity with methodologies like Agile, Scrum, or Waterfall.


Preferred:


Experience in [insert industry, e.g., finance, healthcare, retail].
Knowledge of data analysis tools (e.g., SQL, Tableau, Power BI).
Certification in Business Analysis (e.g., CBAP, CCBA, or PMI-PBA).
